title: Who is on X Factor: Celebrity and when does the series start?
text:
Some familiar faces are heading back for The X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: ITV)

It’s time to face the music again – as The X Factor is back, but not as you know it.

Because this time around it’s the celebrities who’ll be taking centre stage, with 14 acts – all featuring famous faces – lining up to show Simon Cowell and the judges what they can do.

There’s even a record contract awaiting the winner or winners – but just who’ll be taking part in this all new X Factor and when does it start?

Here’s what you need to know…

Who is on Celebrity X Factor?

Here’s who’ll be showing off their vocal skills in a bid to impress Cowell and co.

Unders

Megan McKenna is tipped to do well in the Unders category (Picture: ITV)

Hayley Hasselhoff (model and actress)

Jonny Labey (former Eastenders star)

Kevin McHale (actor)

Megan McKenna (reality star)

Olivia Olson (Love Actually actress)

Advertisement

Advertisement

Overs

This is pretty different territory for journalist Martin Bashir (Picture: ITV)

Martin Bashir (journalist)

Victoria Ekanoye (actress)

Ricki Lake (US talk show host)

Jenny Ryan (aka The Vixen on The Chase)

Groups

They’re not in the villa now…(Picture: ITV)

The Islanders (Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott, Wes Nelson and Eyal Booker)

Try Star (Ben Foden, Thom Evans and Levi Davis)

Cole and Edwards (Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards)

Social Media Stars and CBBC Presenters Max and Harvey

V5: Sofia, Alondra, Laura, Wendii and Natalie

Who are the judges on X Factor: Celebrity?

Oh how we’ve missed Louis (Picture: ITV)

X Factor: Celebrity brings some familiar faces back to the fold, with Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger returning as judges alongside Simon Cowell.

I think everyone’s going to love watching these celebrities because it’s not what people expect,’ Louis said.

‘Some of them are really good. The show feels more exciting, there’s no bootcamp, no six chair challenge, it feels slick this year. It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding, I suppose, a new X Factor.’

Meanwhile Nicole said of her return: ‘I didn’t have any concerns about coming back, it’s in my blood to do this. Simon really wanted me back, so we made a pact and we made it work.’

When does the series start?

X Factor: Celebrity begins on ITV on Saturday night at 8.35pm.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.
